Class Topology

java.lang.Object
Network.Topology
public class Topology extends Object
The Topology class manages the network topology, registering devices, connecting and disconnecting devices, and maintaining the adjacency list to represent the device network structure. It also provides methods to check connections between devices and display port connections.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

  • Constructor Details

    • Topology

      public Topology()
      Default constructor for the Topology class.

  • Method Details

    • setNetworkManager

      public void setNetworkManager(NetworkManager manager)
      Sets the network manager for the topology.
      Parameters:
      manager - The NetworkManager instance to manage network operations.

    • registerDevice

      public void registerDevice(Device device)
      Registers a device in the network topology. Each device is assigned a map of ports that are initially set to null.
      Parameters:
      device - The device to register in the topology.

    • connectDevices

      public void connectDevices(Device source, Device target)
      Connects two devices by assigning available ports to each other. If either device is not registered or doesn't have available ports, the connection will not be established. Also sets VLAN IDs if the source device is a Switch.
      Parameters:
      source - The source device to connect.
      target - The target device to connect to the source device.

    • disconnectDevices

      public boolean disconnectDevices(Device source, Device target)
      Disconnects two devices by removing the connection between them.
      Parameters:
      source - The source device to disconnect.
      target - The target device to disconnect from the source device.
      Returns:
      True if the disconnection was successful, false otherwise.

    • updateAdjacencyList

      public Map<String,List<String>> updateAdjacencyList()
      Updates the adjacency list based on the current connections in the network topology. This list represents the network graph, where each device is connected to its neighboring devices.
      Returns:
      The updated adjacency list.

    • printAdjacencyList

      public void printAdjacencyList()
      Prints the network's adjacency list, which shows the devices connected to each device.

    • checkIfConnected

      public Device checkIfConnected(Device startDevice, Class<?> targetType)
      Searches for a connected device of a specific type starting from the given device.
      Parameters:
      startDevice - The device to start the search from.
      targetType - The target device type to search for (e.g., Computer, Switch).
      Returns:
      The found connected device of the target type, or null if not found.

    • findConnectedDeviceByName

      public Device findConnectedDeviceByName(Device startDevice, String targetDeviceName)
      Searches for a device by name in the network starting from a given device.
      Parameters:
      startDevice - The device to start the search from.
      targetDeviceName - The name of the target device to find.
      Returns:
      The device found, or null if not found.

    • findConnectedDeviceByIP

      public Device findConnectedDeviceByIP(Device startDevice, String targetDeviceIP)
      Searches for a device by its IP address in the network starting from a given device.
      Parameters:
      startDevice - The device to start the search from.
      targetDeviceIP - The IP address of the target device to find.
      Returns:
      The device found, or null if not found.

    • printPortConnections

      public void printPortConnections(Device device)
      Prints the port connections of a given device in the network topology. It shows the port names and the names of the devices connected to those ports. If a port is empty (not connected), it will display "Empty".
      Parameters:
      device - The device whose port connections will be printed.

    • getRegisteredDevices

      public Map<String,Device> getRegisteredDevices()
      Retrieves the map of all registered devices in the network. The map contains device names as keys and the corresponding Device objects as values.
      Returns:
      A map of registered devices with the device name as the key and Device object as the value.

    • getTopology

      public Map<String,Map<String,Device>> getTopology()
      Retrieves the entire network topology. The map contains device names as keys, with each device's ports mapped to connected devices.
      Returns:
      A map representing the network topology, where each device's ports are mapped to other devices.

    • getDeviceByIp

      public Device getDeviceByIp(String ipAddress)
      Retrieves a device from the network by its IP address.
      Parameters:
      ipAddress - The IP address of the device to search for.
      Returns:
      The device with the given IP address, or null if no such device exists.
